meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I've got my VR headset on, and I'm ready to dive into the world of Moss: Book II! This sequel has been getting rave reviews from critics, so let's see if it lives up to the hype.

First off, kudos to Polyarc for creating a game that looks stunning even on old tech (looking at you, PSVR). The art direction is simply gorgeous, with lush environments and adorable characters. Quill, the little mouse protagonist, is as charming as ever, and I love how she interacts with her environment.

Now, let's talk gameplay. Moss: Book II builds upon its predecessor nicely, adding more platforming challenges and a bigger world to explore. The controls are still smooth and responsive, making it a joy to navigate Quill through the levels.

But what really sets this game apart is its emotional storytelling. I won't spoil the story for you, but let's just say that Polyarc has done an amazing job of crafting a narrative that will tug at your heartstrings. It's not just about the gameplay; it's about the journey you take with Quill.

Of course, no review would be complete without mentioning the critics' scores. IGN gave Moss: Book II an 80, citing the game's captivating world and entertaining platforming as major highlights. Vandal echoed these sentiments, praising the game's fantastic adventure and worth-your-time gameplay. SpazioGames agreed, stating that despite PS VR's aging tech, Moss: Book II improves what the original did and is one of the best games for this platform to date.

Eurogamer didn't have a score (yet), but they praised the game's staggering beauty, calling it "reason enough" to dust off your PSVR. GamingTrend gave it an 85, noting that while the game is held back by small bugs, its novel use of VR and heartfelt story make it worth your attention.

COGconnected went all out, giving Moss: Book II a 90 and praising Polyarc for forging an adventure "for the ages." They highlighted the art direction, emotional storytelling, and improved gameplay as major highlights. Eurogamer Italy agreed, calling the game "incredibly entertaining" and feeling like a natural evolution of the original.

All in all, Moss: Book II is a must-play for VR enthusiasts. It's not groundbreaking, but it's still an incredibly charming and engaging experience that will leave you smiling (and maybe even tearing up).

Hippo out!
